[[Image:Efez Celsus Library 3 RB.jpg|thumb|200px|[[Personification]] of wisdom (in [[Greek language|Greek]], "''Σοφία''" or "''[[Sophia (wisdom)|Sophia]]''") at the [[Celsus Library]] in [[Ephesus]], [[Turkey]].]]
    −
'''Wisdom''' is having gained [[knowledge]], [[understanding]],[[experience]], discretion, and [[Intuition (knowledge)|intuitive]] [[understanding]], along with a capacity to apply these qualities well. It is the judicious application of knowledge.{{Fact|date=April 2008}} To some extent the terms wisdom and [[intelligence]] have similar and overlapping meanings. The status of wisdom or [[prudence]] as a [[virtue]] is recognized in [[cultural]], [[philosophical]] and [[religious]] sources.
+
'''Wisdom''' is having gained [[knowledge]], [[understanding]], [[experience]], discretion, and [[Intuition (knowledge)|intuitive]] [[understanding]], along with a capacity to apply these qualities well. It is the judicious application of knowledge.{{Fact|date=April 2008}} To some extent the terms wisdom and [[intelligence]] have similar and overlapping meanings. The status of wisdom or [[prudence]] as a [[virtue]] is recognized in [[cultural]], [[philosophical]] and [[religious]] sources.
